projects.title: Pathbrite
projects.descriptionShort: Large scale ed-tech BackboneJS application with lots of features & tools for teachers, students, and institutions.
projects.description:
Pathbrite is a large scale education technology Backbone web application (with e-portfolio creation). I worked on the platform remotely for about 10 months and built several new key features as well as fixed and improved existing functionality. Most of the features for this site were completed within 2 week sprints.

Tasks included building a new course learning outcomes file browser so teachers could nest and organize them however they want. A larger feature I worked on was a new student assignment submission flow that included the ability to save multiple submitted versions and drafts of assignment items. Other responsibilities included institutional reports, restructuring and reimplementing the design for the course and admin sections, bug finding and fixing, improving sections on mobile and touch devices, and writing CasperJS FE functional tests.

projects.title: Lux Ahoy
projects.description:
Coming from a Flash background, Lux Ahoy was a fun challenge to see just how far we could push the HTML5 canvas tag to allow for the same type of rich animation and interactivity in the browser.

I leveraged several new (at the time) javascript frameworks such as CreateJS and Box2dWeb to create an engaging pirate mayhem game. It includes 3 fully destructible environments with detailed character and level animations plus wind, buoyancy, and projectile dynamics.

projects.title: Soup Stories
projects.descriptionShort: A top-down table site showcasing some information (and ingredients) from Panera Bread
projects.description:
Panera Bread's Soup Stories is a responsive panning microsite that features a virtual butcher's block full of tasty ingredients, soups, and information about the company and it's commitment to the community.

One of my tasks was the overall panning motion for each section of the site. To accomplish this, I used CSS3 transitions and 3d transforms to create a smooth transition (with jQuery fallbacks of course). I was also responsible for building sections of the site including soup stories, daily soups, and feeding america. Other tasks included progressive loading of images for the table and (my personal favorite) programatic steam that rises off the soups.

projects.title: What If
projects.descriptionShort: A layered parallax scrolling HTML5 site.
projects.description: As part of Morgan Stanley's What If marketing campaign they requested a layered parallax site to match the print and video work. Utilizing the latest CSS3 and javascript techniques I helped to create an elegant image-driven experience. As the user scrolls the page, large silhouettes of Morgan Stanley financial advisors reveal cityscapes, rivers, and bridges. Each section of the site also features an audio clip, video, and information about each of their core values and their promises to customers. I was responsible for the overall UI of the site including the menu, all advisor info sections, intro, sharing, etc.

projects.title: Live Consciously
projects.descriptionShort: A Rube Goldberg inspired interactive site.
projects.description: This Rube Goldberg inspired site features four interactive sections as well as informative articles featuring Panera news. When navigating sections, the site animates dynamically to each new section instead of using a hard refresh. Also notable is the 'Explore More' section in which users are expected to interact some way with the site to begin the chain reaction video. One of the toughest challenges of this site was fixing and optimizing functionality & animations for tablet devices.

projects.title: Luxurious Animals
projects.descriptionShort: The company CMS website for Luxurious Animals.
projects.description: This is an Expression Engine driven CMS website for Luxurious Animals that I helped build during my time there. I made sure each section of the site was very easy to update even without knowing anything about html or front end scripting. Features include a sortable and searchable portfolio, blog, and about sections. I also assisted in the early stages of design.

projects.title: The Maester's Path
projects.descriptionShort: An interactive Flash website for HBO's Game of Thrones.
projects.description: This was a Flash based interactive experience website for HBO's launch of the new Game of Thrones series. Users were expected to explore the world, solve puzzles, and unlock sneak-peak videos as rewards. Each section of the site features highly detailed animations, textures, and interactivity.

projects.title: Design Your Dream Hangout
projects.descriptionShort: A site for kids to design and create their dream hangout spot.
projects.description: Lunchables' Design Your Dream Hangout site gives kids the opportunity to create, save, and share their ultimate hangout spot. Each of the three environments features a plethora of objects, creatures, and patterns to ensure no two hangouts are alike. Users also have the ability to rotate and colorize any object they drop into a scene. This site also features a gallery section so users can see what other people have created.

projects.title: Winning On The Road
projects.descriptionShort: A zooming 3D HTML5 parallax scrolling site.
projects.description: This 3D zooming parallax site showcases CDW's experience in providing large-scale technology solutions. I helped to set up some of the scene layering as well as the mobile version of the site.

projects.title: Adventure Country
projects.descriptionShort: A Flash site featuring a virtual city within a postcard.
projects.description: This Flash site features a living interactive city within a postcard for the purpose of introducing two new original reality shows on CMT. Users can watch the action & rescues unfold, explore the city to find hidden artifacts, or watch trailer videos for the new shows.

projects.title: Previous Portfolio
projects.description: This was my old portfolio site from my college days at the Rochester Institute of Technology in 2007. Unfortunately it is not live anymore, but it featured a very minimalistic design and a draggable center bar for resizing content and project information on the fly.
